item.title: With So Many Obamacare Repeal Options In Play, Confusion Reigns
item.description: July 20, 2017 - Congress has been trying to repeal and/or replace the Affordable Care Act for years. Now it's down to the wire, but there are multiple proposals on the Senate's table, and more could be on the way.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - Congress has been trying to repeal and/or replace the Affordable Care Act for years. Now it's down to the wire, but there are multiple proposals on the Senate's table, and more could be on the way. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/538360550/with-so-many-obamacare-repeal-options-in-play-confusion-reigns

item.title: Senate Republicans Look Down Uncertain Path On Health Care
item.description: July 20, 2017 - Some Senate Republicans have suggested they will work with Democrats to craft legislation on health care after their party failed repeatedly to pass a bill on their own. But that is also an uncertain path.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - Some Senate Republicans have suggested they will work with Democrats to craft legislation on health care after their party failed repeatedly to pass a bill on their own. But that is also an uncertain path. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538370615/senate-republicans-look-down-uncertain-path-on-health-care

item.title: GOP Effort To Make Environmental Science 'Transparent' Worries Scientists
item.description: July 20, 2017 - There's a push in Congress to rewrite how science gets used in regulation — and that has researchers worried. The industry-backed bill would let business nitpick raw data and ignore valid results.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - There's a push in Congress to rewrite how science gets used in regulation — and that has researchers worried. The industry-backed bill would let business nitpick raw data and ignore valid results. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/537243392/gop-effort-to-make-environmental-science-transparent-worries-scientists

item.title: Newest Senate Health Care Overhaul Would Increase Uninsured By 22 Million, CBO Says
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The latest report has similar findings to prior estimates: big increases in the uninsured population, with some deficit reduction. But there's a big caveat: This bill will likely change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The latest report has similar findings to prior estimates: big increases in the uninsured population, with some deficit reduction. But there's a big caveat: This bill will likely change. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538343377/newest-senate-health-care-overhaul-to-increase-uninsured-by-22-million-cbo-says

item.title: John McCain Was Diagnosed With A Glioblastoma, Among The Deadliest Of Cancers
item.description: July 20, 2017 - About 12,000 people are diagnosed with a glioblastoma each year in the U.S. Fewer than a third of them will survive beyond two years.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - About 12,000 people are diagnosed with a glioblastoma each year in the U.S. Fewer than a third of them will survive beyond two years. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/538295015/john-mccain-was-diagnosed-with-a-glioblastoma-among-the-deadliest-of-cancers

item.title: The Side Effect Of That New Malaria Drug? American Jobs
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The Trump administration wants to cut the U.S. global health budget. A new study puts a different spin on the spending.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The Trump administration wants to cut the U.S. global health budget. A new study puts a different spin on the spending. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/20/538114370/the-side-effect-of-that-new-malaria-drug-american-jobs

item.title: Just Thinking You're Slacking On Exercise Could Boost Risk Of Death
item.description: July 20, 2017 - People who think others are more active tend to have shorter lifespans, even if they're actually getting the same amount of exercise. The social comparison could kill motivation, researchers say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - People who think others are more active tend to have shorter lifespans, even if they're actually getting the same amount of exercise. The social comparison could kill motivation, researchers say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/538157820/just-thinking-youre-slacking-on-exercise-could-boost-risk-of-death

item.title: Opioid Treatment Funds In Senate Bill Would Fall Far Short Of Needs
item.description: July 20, 2017 - A Senate proposal to repeal Obamacare includes $45 billion to treat opioid addiction. But it wouldn't make up for deep cuts to Medicaid in that same bill that has funded much of that treatment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - A Senate proposal to repeal Obamacare includes $45 billion to treat opioid addiction. But it wouldn't make up for deep cuts to Medicaid in that same bill that has funded much of that treatment. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/537661375/opioid-treatment-funds-in-senate-bill-would-fall-far-short-of-needs

item.title: Uncertainty Over Obamacare Leaves Next Year's Rates In Limbo
item.description: July 19, 2017 - While Washington ponders the future of the Affordable Care Act, health insurers need to decide right now what to charge people for health insurance in 2018. "It's insane," says one CEO.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - While Washington ponders the future of the Affordable Care Act, health insurers need to decide right now what to charge people for health insurance in 2018. "It's insane," says one CEO. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/19/538099050/uncertainty-over-obamacare-leaves-next-years-rates-in-limbo

item.title: Her Own Medical Future At Stake, A Child Storms Capitol Hill
item.description: July 19, 2017 - The Republican health care bill failed in part because of opposition to shrinking Medicaid. An 11-year-old girl with sickle cell anemia went to Washington, D.C., to make sure that wouldn't happen.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - The Republican health care bill failed in part because of opposition to shrinking Medicaid. An 11-year-old girl with sickle cell anemia went to Washington, D.C., to make sure that wouldn't happen. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/19/537208601/her-own-medical-future-at-stake-a-child-stormed-capitol-hill

item.title: Why Zika Is Especially Hard On The Women Of Brazil
item.description: July 19, 2017 - They've been largely responsible for warding off mosquitoes at home — and caring for the children born with microcephaly. A new study says that the government has not given them the support they need.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - They've been largely responsible for warding off mosquitoes at home — and caring for the children born with microcephaly. A new study says that the government has not given them the support they need. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/19/537062303/why-zika-is-especially-hard-on-the-women-of-brazil

item.description:

item.title: Social Interaction Improves Quality Of Life For People With Dementia
item.description: July 19, 2017 - Patients with memory loss and other cognitive problems responded well to one-on-one conversations aimed at increasing their sense of control and independence.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - Patients with memory loss and other cognitive problems responded well to one-on-one conversations aimed at increasing their sense of control and independence. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/19/537907127/for-dementia-patients-engagement-can-improve-mood-and-quality-of-life

item.title: Chipotle Stock Dips After Some Va. Customers Report Illness
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Chipotle temporarily closed a Sterling, Va., restaurant to sanitize it. A company representative told NPR that the reported symptoms were consistent with norovirus.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Chipotle temporarily closed a Sterling, Va., restaurant to sanitize it. A company representative told NPR that the reported symptoms were consistent with norovirus. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/18/537954003/chipotle-stocks-dip-after-some-va-customers-report-illness

item.title: Why It's So Hard To Stop The World's Looming Famines
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Millions of people in Yemen and sub-Saharan Africa are facing food shortages and severe malnutrition. Host Audie Cornish talks with Justin Forsyth of UNICEF about the crisis.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Millions of people in Yemen and sub-Saharan Africa are facing food shortages and severe malnutrition. Host Audie Cornish talks with Justin Forsyth of UNICEF about the crisis. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/18/537907401/why-its-so-hard-to-stop-the-worlds-looming-famines
